current_subquestions: Q1: Identify the pattern of the color changes in the examples.
new_subanswers_ys: A1: The pattern of the color changes in the examples is that the color of the cells inside a closed shape changes to the color of the cell that is in the center of the shape. If there are multiple cells in the center, the color changes to the color of the cell that is not zero. If all the cells in the center are zero, the color does not change.

A2: We can apply this pattern to the quiz input by identifying the closed shapes and the cells in their centers. Then, we change the color of the cells inside the shapes to the color of the cells in the centers. If there are multiple cells in the center, we choose the color of the cell that is not zero. If all the cells in the center are zero, we do not change the color.
